moves.1. a4 e5 2. a5 d5 3. e3 f5 4. a6: Thematic tournament begins from this position
moves.5. d4 e4: Black tries to lock in the center
moves.6... c6: Black wants to bring the N back from the rim.
moves.8. c4: White begins the counterattack against the center.
moves.8... Nc7: Black plans on bringing the N back into play.
moves.9. Nh5: This exchange tries to weaken Black's K position.
moves.9... g6: Black puts the question to the N.
moves.10. Nxf6+ Qxf6 11. Qb3: Similar to a French Defense reversed, white puts pressure on d5 and b7.
moves.11... Be6: ?? This is a losing blunder. I forgot about the threat to b7.
moves.12. Qxb7: Of course, Black must protect the N but how?
moves.12... Kd7: Hoping for some variation where Black can trap the Q at b7,
moves.14. Ra6: !! However this is fatal. Not only does Rb8 fail to Qxc6+ but there is no way of defending c6. Black must lose material and his king position will be a chronic problem. Given my opponents rating resignation was in order.

gameName: Walking the Walk and Learning to Run Part 5
